fields.headline: Slow road to China
fields.bodyText: Shadow of the Silk Road by Colin Thubron, read by Jonathan Keeble Isis £19.99 cassettes/£28.99 CDs During the Sars epidemic of 2003, Thubron made a gargantuan trip on battered buses and trains along the ancient Silk Route from China, across mountainous Central Asia, Afghanistan and Iran into Turkish Kurdistan. His travelogue plaits together strands from the splendid imperial past of jade and silk with the present: countries released from Soviet ideology and now gripped by fundamentalism. He searches out ordinary people everywhere - in Uzbekistan, for instance, herdsmen in yurts ply him with vodka and delicacies from freshly killed sheep - encounters which reveal the conflicts of this ferment of religions, culture and 'progress', like the Afghan woman able to communicate with a man only by a mobile hidden in her burqa.
